title: Getting Started with peruopen
text: peruopen package provides comprehensive interface Peru’s CKAN data portal (datosabiertos.gob.pe), enabling search, discover, download open government datasets directly R. peruopen, can access 3,954 datasets 10,000+ resources 283+ government organizations Peru.

title: Getting Started with peruopen
text: Install package GitHub:
code: # Install from GitHub devtools::install_github("horaciochacon/peruopen") library(peruopen)

title: Getting Started with peruopen
text: Start getting complete catalog available datasets: catalog contains: - datasets: Information available datasets - resources: Details individual files data resources - summary: Statistics catalog Search surveillance data CDC (Centro Nacional de Epidemiología): Download resources directly R: Find data specific government organizations like MINSA: Search ubigeo (geographic codes) data INEI: Search demographic survey data:
code: # Get the complete catalog (may take a few minutes on first run) catalog <- po_catalog(refresh = TRUE)  # Explore the catalog structure catalog catalog$datasets catalog$resources # Search for datasets with CDC tags vigilancia <- po_search(tags = "cdc") vigilancia  # Explore the results vigilancia$datasets vigilancia$resources # Download all resources from the CDC search po_get(vigilancia$resources) # Search for all MINSA (Ministry of Health) datasets minsa <- po_search(organizations = "MINSA") minsa minsa$datasets # Search for ubigeo data from INEI using both tags and organization ubigeo <- po_search(tags = "ubigeo", organizations = "INEI") ubigeo ubigeo$datasets ubigeo$resources  # Download the ubigeo data po_get(ubigeo$resources) # Search for ENDES (Demographic and Health Survey) data from INEI endes <- po_search(query = "ENDES", organizations = "INEI") endes endes$datasets

title: Getting Started with peruopen
text: Start getting complete catalog available datasets: catalog contains: - datasets: Information available datasets - resources: Details individual files data resources - summary: Statistics catalog
code: # Get the complete catalog (may take a few minutes on first run) catalog <- po_catalog(refresh = TRUE)  # Explore the catalog structure catalog catalog$datasets catalog$resources

title: Getting Started with peruopen
text: Search surveillance data CDC (Centro Nacional de Epidemiología):
code: # Search for datasets with CDC tags vigilancia <- po_search(tags = "cdc") vigilancia  # Explore the results vigilancia$datasets vigilancia$resources

title: Getting Started with peruopen
text: Download resources directly R:
code: # Download all resources from the CDC search po_get(vigilancia$resources)

title: Getting Started with peruopen
text: Find data specific government organizations like MINSA:
code: # Search for all MINSA (Ministry of Health) datasets minsa <- po_search(organizations = "MINSA") minsa minsa$datasets

title: Getting Started with peruopen
text: Search ubigeo (geographic codes) data INEI:
code: # Search for ubigeo data from INEI using both tags and organization ubigeo <- po_search(tags = "ubigeo", organizations = "INEI") ubigeo ubigeo$datasets ubigeo$resources  # Download the ubigeo data po_get(ubigeo$resources)

title: Getting Started with peruopen
text: Search demographic survey data:
code: # Search for ENDES (Demographic and Health Survey) data from INEI endes <- po_search(query = "ENDES", organizations = "INEI") endes endes$datasets

title: Getting Started with peruopen
text: Use po_explore() get organized views data catalog:
code: # General exploration of all data overview <- po_explore()  # Explore health-related data specifically health_data <- po_explore("salud")  # See what organizations publish the most data overview$by_organization  # Find the most common file formats overview$by_format

title: Getting Started with peruopen
code: # Find all CSV files about education education_csv <- po_search("educacion", formats = "CSV")  # Get only Excel files excel_data <- po_search(formats = c("XLSX", "XLS")) # Find health datasets from MINSA in CSV format health_csv <- po_search(   query = "salud",   organizations = "MINSA",    formats = "CSV" )  # Search by multiple tags health_tags <- po_search(tags = c("salud", "epidemiologia")) # Download and save files to local directory po_get("dataset-name", save_to = "data/peru/")

title: Getting Started with peruopen
code: # Find all CSV files about education education_csv <- po_search("educacion", formats = "CSV")  # Get only Excel files excel_data <- po_search(formats = c("XLSX", "XLS"))

title: Getting Started with peruopen
code: # Find health datasets from MINSA in CSV format health_csv <- po_search(   query = "salud",   organizations = "MINSA",    formats = "CSV" )  # Search by multiple tags health_tags <- po_search(tags = c("salud", "epidemiologia"))

title: Getting Started with peruopen
code: # Download and save files to local directory po_get("dataset-name", save_to = "data/peru/")

title: Getting Started with peruopen
code: # Get all health datasets from MINSA health_data <- po_search(organizations = "MINSA")  # Find COVID-19 related data covid_data <- po_search("covid")  # Get malaria surveillance data malaria <- po_search("malaria", formats = "CSV") # Find budget execution data from MEF budget_data <- po_search(organizations = "MEF")  # Search for economic indicators economic <- po_search("economico") # Get census data from INEI census_data <- po_search(organizations = "INEI", tags = "censo")  # Find geographic boundary data boundaries <- po_search("limite", formats = "SHP")

title: Getting Started with peruopen
code: # Get all health datasets from MINSA health_data <- po_search(organizations = "MINSA")  # Find COVID-19 related data covid_data <- po_search("covid")  # Get malaria surveillance data malaria <- po_search("malaria", formats = "CSV")

title: Getting Started with peruopen
code: # Find budget execution data from MEF budget_data <- po_search(organizations = "MEF")  # Search for economic indicators economic <- po_search("economico")

title: Getting Started with peruopen
code: # Get census data from INEI census_data <- po_search(organizations = "INEI", tags = "censo")  # Find geographic boundary data boundaries <- po_search("limite", formats = "SHP")

title: Getting Started with peruopen
text: Peru’s open data portal includes datasets : MINSA - Ministry Health (epidemiological data, health statistics) MEF - Ministry Economy (budget execution, economic indicators) MINEDU - Ministry Education (educational statistics) INEI - National Statistics Institute (census, demographic data) Regional Governments - Local statistics programs 283+ organizations total portal contains approximately 1.7 TB data across resources.

title: Getting Started with peruopen
text: Use ?function_name help specific functions Browse function reference Report issues GitHub

what: peruopen - Access Peru's Open Data Portal
title: peruopen - Access Peru's Open Data Portal
text: peruopen provides comprehensive R interface Peru’s CKAN data portal (datosabiertos.gob.pe), enabling users search, discover, download open government datasets directly R.

title: peruopen - Access Peru's Open Data Portal
text: 🔍 Smart Search: Search across 3,954+ datasets flexible filtering organization, format, content 📊 Data Catalog: Browse complete catalog metadata datasets 10,000+ resources ⚡ Fast Downloads: Intelligent resource selection caching efficient data access 🎨 Beautiful Output: Colored console output easy data exploration 🔄 Robust API: Built-retry logic error handling reliable data access 📖 Rich Metadata: Access complete dataset information including organizations, formats, descriptions

title: peruopen - Access Peru's Open Data Portal
text: can install development version peruopen GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("horaciochacon/peruopen")

title: peruopen - Access Peru's Open Data Portal
code: library(peruopen)  # Get the complete data catalog (3,954 datasets, 10,000+ resources) catalog <- po_catalog()  # Search for COVID-related data covid_data <- po_search("covid") covid_data  # Explore data by topic health_data <- po_explore("salud") health_data  # Download a specific dataset malaria_data <- po_get("malaria-2024")  # Find all CSV files about dengue dengue_csv <- po_search("dengue", formats = "CSV")

title: peruopen - Access Peru's Open Data Portal
code: # Search across all fields climate_data <- po_search("cambio climático")  # Filter by organization minsa_data <- po_search(organizations = "MINSA")  # Find specific file formats excel_files <- po_search(formats = c("XLSX", "XLS"))  # Search only in tags health_tags <- po_search("salud", search_tags_only = TRUE)

title: peruopen - Access Peru's Open Data Portal
code: # Explore all available data overview <- po_explore()  # Focus on specific topic education <- po_explore("educación")  # See what organizations publish data overview$by_organization

title: peruopen - Access Peru's Open Data Portal
code: # Download best available resource from dataset data <- po_get("covid-vaccinations")  # Get specific format csv_data <- po_get("dataset-name", format = "CSV")  # Download multiple resources resources <- catalog$resources %>%    filter(format == "CSV", size_mb < 50) all_data <- po_get(resources)  # Save files locally po_get("dataset-name", save_to = "data/peru/")

title: peruopen - Access Peru's Open Data Portal
text: Peru open data portal contains: 3,954 datasets 283+ government organizations 10,000+ resources multiple formats (CSV, Excel, JSON, PDF, etc.) ~1.7 TB total data across resources Regular updates ministries, regional governments, agencies

title: peruopen - Access Peru's Open Data Portal
text: package connects Peru’s official open data portal, provides access datasets : MINSA (Ministry Health) - Health statistics, epidemiological data MEF (Ministry Economy) - Budget execution, economic indicators MINEDU (Ministry Education) - Educational statistics INEI (National Statistics Institute) - Census, demographic data Regional Governments - Local statistics programs 278+ organizations

title: peruopen - Access Peru's Open Data Portal
text: See vignette("getting-started") detailed examples Browse function reference Report bugs github.com/horaciochacon/peruopen/issues

title: peruopen - Access Peru's Open Data Portal
text: Please note peruopen project released Contributor Code Conduct. contributing project, agree abide terms.

what: peruopen: Access Peru's Open Data Portal (CKAN) — peruopen-package
title: peruopen: Access Peru's Open Data Portal (CKAN) — peruopen-package
text: package provides comprehensive interface Peru's CKAN data portal (datosabiertos.gob.pe), enabling users query search datasets, extract metadata, download resources directly R.

title: peruopen: Access Peru's Open Data Portal (CKAN) — peruopen-package
text: po_catalog Get complete data catalog po_search Search datasets resources po_get Smart getter datasets/resources po_explore Interactive data exploration

title: peruopen: Access Peru's Open Data Portal (CKAN) — peruopen-package
text: Maintainer: Horacio Chacón-Torrico hchacont@uw.edu

what: Get searchable catalog of Peru open data with smart loading — po_catalog
title: Get searchable catalog of Peru open data with smart loading — po_catalog
text: Downloads returns catalog datasets resources Peru's open data portal. Uses intelligent chunked loading handle API limitations. Can get partial complete catalogs based target size.

title: Get searchable catalog of Peru open data with smart loading — po_catalog
code: po_catalog(   refresh = FALSE,   verbose = TRUE,   target_size = NULL,   extend_existing = FALSE )

title: Get searchable catalog of Peru open data with smart loading — po_catalog
text: refresh Logical. Force refresh cached catalog (default FALSE) verbose Logical. Show progress messages (default TRUE) target_size Integer. Number datasets fetch (default NULL = try 3954) extend_existing Logical. Add data existing catalog (default FALSE)

title: Get searchable catalog of Peru open data with smart loading — po_catalog
text: list containing: datasets Tibble datasets summary information resources Tibble resources linked parent datasets summary List catalog statistics metadata

title: Get searchable catalog of Peru open data with smart loading — po_catalog
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get a working subset (1000-1500 datasets) catalog <- po_catalog(target_size = 1500)  # Get more coverage progressively catalog <- po_catalog(target_size = 2500)  # Try to get everything (may timeout) catalog <- po_catalog()  # Extend existing catalog with more data more_catalog <- po_catalog(target_size = 3000, extend_existing = TRUE)  # Find all CSV files under 50MB csv_files <- catalog$resources %>%   filter(format == "CSV", size_mb < 50)  # Find datasets by organization minsa_data <- catalog$datasets %>%   filter(grepl("MINSA", organization)) } # }

what: Clear cache and rebuild complete catalog with target size — po_catalog_rebuild
title: Clear cache and rebuild complete catalog with target size — po_catalog_rebuild
text: Workaround extension caching issue. Clears cache rebuilds catalog scratch target size.

title: Clear cache and rebuild complete catalog with target size — po_catalog_rebuild
code: po_catalog_rebuild(target_size = 3000, verbose = TRUE)

title: Clear cache and rebuild complete catalog with target size — po_catalog_rebuild
text: target_size Number datasets load verbose Show progress

title: Download a resource file — po_download_resource
text: Download resource file

title: Download a resource file — po_download_resource
code: po_download_resource(   resource_id,   path = NULL,   overwrite = FALSE,   use_cache = TRUE )

title: Download a resource file — po_download_resource
text: resource_id Character. resource ID path Character. Local file path (optional, uses temp directory NULL) overwrite Logical. Whether overwrite existing files (default FALSE) use_cache Logical. Use cached files available (default TRUE)

title: Download a resource file — po_download_resource
text: Character path downloaded file

what: Interactive exploration of Peru's open data — po_explore
title: Interactive exploration of Peru's open data — po_explore
text: Provides structured views data catalog help discover relevant datasets. Returns organized summaries different dimensions.

title: Interactive exploration of Peru's open data — po_explore
code: po_explore(query = NULL, verbose = TRUE)

title: Interactive exploration of Peru's open data — po_explore
text: query Optional search term focus exploration verbose Logical. Show exploration progress (default TRUE)

title: Interactive exploration of Peru's open data — po_explore
text: list multiple views data: by_organization Datasets grouped publishing organization by_format Resources grouped file format by_year Temporal distribution datasets by_size Size distribution largest datasets recent Recently updated datasets popular Datasets resources recommendations Suggested starting points based query

title: Interactive exploration of Peru's open data — po_explore
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # General exploration explore <- po_explore()  # Explore health-related data health <- po_explore("salud")  # See what MINSA publishes explore$by_organization$MINSA  # Find all available Excel files explore$by_format$XLSX } # }

what: Smart getter for Peru open data — po_get
title: Smart getter for Peru open data — po_get
text: Intelligently fetches data metadata based identifier(s) provided. Works dataset names, dataset IDs, resource IDs, tibbles po_catalog/po_search.

title: Smart getter for Peru open data — po_get
code: po_get(   identifier,   what = c("data", "info", "all"),   format = NULL,   clean_names = TRUE,   save_to = NULL,   encoding = c("UTF-8", "Latin1", "Windows-1252", "ISO-8859-1", "auto"),   use_cache = TRUE,   verbose = TRUE )

title: Smart getter for Peru open data — po_get
text: identifier Dataset name, dataset ID, resource ID(s), tibble resources get: "data" (default), "info", "" format Preferred format multiple available (e.g., "CSV", "XLSX") clean_names Logical. Clean column names R compatibility (default TRUE) save_to Directory path save downloaded files (default NULL = saving) encoding Character encoding: "UTF-8" (default), "Latin1", "Windows-1252", "ISO-8859-1", "auto" use_cache Logical. Use cached files available (default TRUE) verbose Logical. Show download progress (default TRUE)

title: Smart getter for Peru open data — po_get
text: Depending input: Single resource data.frame/tibble metadata depending '' Multiple resources named list data/metadata resource Dataset Data/metadata best available resource

title: Smart getter for Peru open data — po_get
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Get data using dataset name malaria <- po_get("malaria-2024")  # Get metadata only info <- po_get("malaria-2024", what = "info")  # Get specific resource by ID data <- po_get("abc-123-resource-id")  # Get multiple resources resources <- po_get(c("resource-id-1", "resource-id-2"))  # Get resources from catalog/search results catalog <- po_catalog() csv_resources <- catalog$resources %>% filter(format == "CSV") all_csv_data <- po_get(csv_resources)  # Save files locally with original names data <- po_get("dataset-name", save_to = "data/peru/")  # Force specific encoding for Spanish characters data <- po_get("resource-id", encoding = "Windows-1252") data <- po_get("resource-id", encoding = "ISO-8859-1")  # Cache control examples data <- po_get("resource-id")  # Uses cache if available data <- po_get("resource-id", use_cache = FALSE)  # Force fresh download } # }

what: Unified search across Peru's open data catalog — po_search
title: Unified search across Peru's open data catalog — po_search
text: Search across datasets resources Peru's open data portal. Returns results organized datasets associated resources.

title: Unified search across Peru's open data catalog — po_search
code: po_search(   query = NULL,   tags = NULL,   type = c("all", "datasets", "resources"),   formats = NULL,   organizations = NULL,   search_tags_only = FALSE,   use_cache = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Unified search across Peru's open data catalog — po_search
text: query Character string search (searches titles, descriptions, organizations, tags) tags Character vector tags search tag fields type search: "" (default), "datasets", "resources" formats Character vector resource formats filter (e.g., c("CSV", "XLSX")) organizations Character vector organizations filter search_tags_only Logical. TRUE query provided, search tag fields (default FALSE) use_cache Logical. Use cached catalog (default TRUE) verbose Logical. Show search progress (default FALSE)

title: Unified search across Peru's open data catalog — po_search
text: list containing: datasets Tibble matching datasets resources Tibble resources matching datasets summary Search result statistics

title: Unified search across Peru's open data catalog — po_search
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Search everything related to COVID covid_data <- po_search("covid")  # Find all CSV files about dengue dengue_csv <- po_search("dengue", formats = "CSV")  # Get all resources from MINSA minsa <- po_search(organizations = "MINSA", type = "resources")  # Search by specific tags health_data <- po_search(tags = c("salud", "medicina"))  # Search only in tag fields (not titles/descriptions) tag_only <- po_search("covid", search_tags_only = TRUE)  # Just search for resources directly csv_files <- po_search(type = "resources", formats = "CSV") } # }
